page.title: 06SOME BUILDINGS IN GUILDFORD
page.content: Three notable buildings in Guildford High Street are the Civic Hall, the Guildford Museum and Guildford House. The Civic Hall is a venue for many rock groups and choirs. An annual school festival of singing is held there as well as many meetings of schools and other organisations. The Guildford Museum is hardly noticeable from its exterior, as it is just a building near the River Wey, but inside it has a wealth of historical remnants, ranging from Stone Age weapons and burial ornaments through musical instruments to iron work and embroidery. Guildford House houses many exhibitions of paintings, sculpture and embroidery. It is a mainly wooden structure and has a beautiful wooden staircase inside. Its many rooms have polished wooden floors. Anna Knights
